alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 11 at 4:38AM AKDT until October 13 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible, with locally higher amounts along the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to overspread the Copper River Basin from south to north beginning Wednesday afternoon. THe snow may mix with rain at times along the Edgerton Highway, as temperatures climb into the mid to upper 30s. Farther north, precipitation is expected to stay all snow. Any mixed precipitation should change to all snow by late Wednesday evening and continue to fall as snow through Thursday morning. Snow is expected to taper off from west to east through the day Thursday. The highest accumulations are expected along the Richardson Highway from Gulkana south and along the Tok Cutoff.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
